CONCLUSION: Violation of P1-1;Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant is the owner of an apartment in GPE , which she had let to M.A.H. on DATE .
CARDINAL . In a writ served on the tenant on CARDINAL DATE the applicant informed the tenant that she intended to terminate the lease and summoned the tenant to appear before ORG .
CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE , which was made enforceable on DATE , ORG upheld the validity of the notice to quit and ordered that the premises must be vacated by DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant served notice on the tenant requiring him to vacate the premises .
CARDINAL . On DATE she served notice on the tenant informing him that the order for possession would be enforced by a bailiff on CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the bailiff made CARDINAL attempts to recover possession . Each attempt proved unsuccessful , as , under the statutory provisions providing for the staggering of evictions , the applicant was not entitled to police assistance in enforcing the order for possession .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant repossessed the premises with the assistance of the police .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is described in the ORG ’s judgment in the case of ORG GPE [ ORG ] , no . CARDINAL , CARDINAL , § § DATE , ORG CARDINAL-V.
